items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

SAN JOSE/EVERGREEN COMMUNITY COLLEGE DISTRICT CHANCELLOR EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT ADDENDUM
	 
Pursuant to Article 17 of the Employment Contract ("Contract" or "Agreement") between San Jose Evergreen Community  College District ("District") and Chancellor Rita Cepeda ("Chancellor") the parties hereby mutually consent to modify Article 7 of the Contract, entitled "Moving  Expenses"  as follows:
	 
1.  Chancellor shall have until June 30, 2011 to expend the moving expense funds provided for in Article 7, and to provide receipts as required in this Article by July 31, 2011.
	 
2.  If receipts are not produced for any portion of the funds by July 31, 2011 that portion of the funds shall be returned to the District within  5 business days.
	 
3.  The extension of time provided for in this Addendum to utilize moving expenses does not change the date of this  Agreement.  For all purposes, the date of this Agreement remains June 22, 2010.  
	 
4.  This Addendum amends Article 7 and is incorporated into the Agreement between the parties as if full set forth in the Agreement. 
	 
5.  This Addendum does not modify any other provision of the Agreement. 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
	 
____________________              _____________________
Rita Cepeda, Chancellor                 Board President

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the district until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees.  District policy adopted on April 10, 2007 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval.  All contracts and purchase orders exceeding the bid limit (currently $78,500) should have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
	 
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes the purchase orders for administratively-approved contracts exceeding $750, as well as additional contracts that although are not executed by way of purchase order are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the attached contracts and purchase orders for the period October 10, 2010 -November 9, 2010.

The @ONE Project provides California Community College faculty and staff learn opportunities for technology that will enhance teaching and student learning and success.  @ONE's programs provide training, online resources and research for free - or at a low cost. The funding comes from the California Community College's Chancellor's Office Telecommunication and Technology Infrastructure Program (TTIP). Evergreen Valley College received grant funding for Year 4 of a five-year grant in the amount of $560,000, Grant Agreement No. 07-131-001.
Evergreen Valley College serves as the fiscal agent for this project.

SJCC Track & Field will have 2 student-athletes participating in the 2011 National Pole Vault Summit in Reno, Nevada January 27-29, 2011. This is a developmental clinic established to promote safety and encourage development of Pole Vaulting skill by athletes at advanced levels. The clinic features both âlearn-by-doingâ as well as lectures and breakout sessions, making it not only a competition but also an educational experience for our student-athletes. This is a unique clinic and will have around5,000 participants as well as top coaches and athletes from 4-year universities, international teams, and Olympic teams. SJCC will be sending two of our athletes to participate in this event: Ruth Ann LeBeau, a returning athlete who took 11th place in the 2010 State Championships Pole Vault Competition, and Aaron Mednick, a promising newcomer to the 2011 team. They will be accompanied by David Flynn, the head Track & Field Coach, and two assistant coaches: Brandon Vance and Frank Strouse. We appreciate your support of our student-athletes with their participation in this exciting and worthwhile event.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees allow the two (2) SJCC Track & Field student-athletes to participate in the 2011 National Pole Vault Summit in Reno, Nevada on January 27-29, 2011.

The District successfully passed Measure G-2010 on November 2, 2010.  This is a Proposition 39 General Obligation Bond with a 55% voter approval threshold and carries the requirement of a citizens bond oversight committee.
		 
This resolution provides amended and restated bylaws to allow for the existing committee to support both Measure G-2004 and Measure G-2010.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the attached resolution amending and restating the Citizen Bond Oversight Committee Bylaws to allow for oversight of both Measure G-2004 and Measure G-2010 by a single committee.

items.item_details:
The District successfully passed Measure G-2010 on November 2, 2010.  This is a Proposition 39 General Obligation Bond with a 55% voter approval threshold and carries the requirement of a citizens bond oversight committee.
	 
The District may have a need to initiate some of the activities authorized under Measure G -2010 as soon as possible.  The coordination and structuring of bond sales takes some time and this resolution allows us to incur reimbursable costs prior to the actual issuance of bonds.
	 
The consequence of not adopting this resolution is a delay in moving forward with project planning and implementation of Measure G-2010 projects which could cost the District additional resources and may delay General Fund savings from energy efficiency project implementation.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended the Governing Board adopt the attached resolution clarifying the Districtâs intent to reimburse project costs related to Measure G-2010 incurred prior to the issuance of bonds.

The 2025 San Jose City and Evergreen Valley Colleges Facilities Master Plans will serve as planning tools and assist in future decision making at each College.  The purpose of these Facilities Master Plans are to provide a guide for future campus development utilizing both Measure G-2004 and Measure G-2010 resources. These plans were preceded by the development and board adoption of the 2025 Educational Master Plans which identify department and discipline based FTES goals to meet the educational mission, serve the changing needs of the community and address the projected enrollment at the colleges through 2025.  
SJCC Interim President Doug Treadway and EVC Acting President Kuni Hay, along with the planning consultant, Deborah Shepley from HMC Architects, will present these draft reports for the Board of Trustees information and provide opportunity for trustee discussion.
	 
The final plans will be brought back to the Board of Trustees January 25, 2011 for final consideration and approval.
